text: Judith Aileen Dyble (pronounced Die-bull;per Simon Nicol's introduction to "Both Sides Now" on Fairport Convention's album Moat on the Ledge 13 February 1949 â€“ 12 July 2020) was an English singer-songwriter and pianist. She was known for being a vocalist and a founding member of Fairport Convention and Trader Horne. She and Ian McDonald joined and recorded several tracks with Giles, Giles and Fripp, who later became King Crimson. Dyble was born in London. Dyble died in Oxfordshire, England on 12 July 2020 from lung cancer, aged 71.Original Fairport Convention singer Judy Dyble dead at 71 ==References== Category:1949 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:English pianists Category:Singer-songwriters from London Category:Musicians from London
title: Judy Dyble
